Posts.Content: cupcake27 wrote: Hey all, I have been reading the threads on here for a few days and thought I would introduce myself and join the conversations! Friday the 18th, right before turkey day, I found a lump in my right breast on the far side near my arm pit. I called my dr. on Monday and they got me right in and am scheduled for a mammo and US on the Thursday the first. Of course my doctor told me not to worry, which I am doing my best not to because I know no matter the outcome God has my back! But...still in the back of my mind...I think about it. I have a wonderful supportive husband and two kids, daughter is 10 and son is 15. The lump is slightly tender and does not move and my dr added to the paper for the mammo that I have thickening as well, though I am not sure what that is. A cupcake a day wont keep the doctor away...but...makes me...smile! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2011 08:20PM cupcake27 wrote: Thanks carpediem for the encouraging words! I try to stay clear of caffeine because I have dealt with cervical cancer five years ago and underwent a radical hysterectomy. I am sure this is nothing because I just cant imagine going through this again...but...then I start thinking about then and how I did not think anything was wrong either so.....just taking it day to day right now...I am so glad to have found this site as it really allows me to involve myself with people who understand :)
